snippet: The law puts new restrictions on Mississippi’s sole abortion clinic, but the ruling protects the clinic from criminal or civil penalties while it tries to come into compliance.
abstract: Federal Judge Daniel P Jordan III partially lifts a barrier on the Mississippi law that would put new restrictions on the state's sole abortion clinic, but blocks parts of it that could expose the clinic to criminal or civil penalties while it tries to come into compliance with the new restrictions.
lead_paragraph: The law puts new restrictions on Mississippi’s sole abortion clinic, but the ruling protects the clinic from criminal or civil penalties while it tries to come into compliance.

headline.seo: Judge Partly Unblocks Mississippi Abortion Law
headline.main: With Limits, Judge Allows Abortion Law in Mississippi
headline.print_headline: With Limits, Judge Allows Abortion Law In Mississippi
